intro: Astragalus hyrcanus, commonly known as the Hyrcan horsegram, is a flowering plant belonging to the legume family, Fabaceae. It is native to Central Asia and is characterized by its erect, branched stems and small, yellowish flowers. The plant produces pods containing several seeds, which are often used as a food source in certain regions. Astragalus hyrcanus is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, showcasing its resilience to drought conditions. Its botanical features make it an important species in ecological and agricultural contexts.
